data.title: Amazing Productions
data.text: We have been so many times and are never disappointed. Great seats throughout. Good sound and outstanding productions.

data.title: Fantastic, these folks love theatre
data.text: Visited many times, easy access, friendly staff, great shows. I'm tall and there's plenty legroom. It's a theatre, what more can I say.

data.title: went to 3 differeant musicals
data.text:
Very very good
Loved the seats
Food a little expensive but it was convenient
Good parking, well lit, must go

data.title: TUTS brings Theater to Houston
data.text: We have been season ticket holders for years. Each season brings outstanding plays for a variety of audiences. Tickets are reasonably priced. This just adds to Houston's city of Arts.

data.title: In the Heights
data.text: High energy, fun dancing and powerful singing. Won't be in my top 10 musicals as it was predictable but entertaining nonetheless.

data.title: We are long-time subscribers
data.text: We have season tickets and we will never let them go! Whether you buy the whole package for the season, or just one show at a time, this is a must for Houstonians and beyond. We love the shows, and it's always a great night out.  Terrific talent! Don't forget to make reservations at Artista to eat dinner if you have a night show -- it's delicious and great service, great food. Our favorite is the crawfish taquitos as an appetizer, and I always get the churrasco steak for dinner. A really fun night out, don't miss it.

data.title: Very good venue, skip the valet parking
data.text:
I have been to numerous TUTS shows over a 15 year period.  The  theater is really world class, and there is a nice variety of shows, all done very professionally.  Among my favorites are the ones that include children from the Humphries school, which the  Houston theater school for children.  

There is a nice area to get drinks before the show, a lobby quick buffet, and the Artista restaurant adjacent to the theater. All good choices.

The valet parking is a poor idea.  The walk from the garage is not far, 2-3 minutes at most. The extra cost for the valet is $10, and the wait after the show can be very long for valet, while if you self park you can be out in minutes.

data.title: Great venue with great shows.
data.text: I have been a season ticket holder since they moved into the Hobby Center.  I especially like the TUTS Underground.  (The shows tend to be edgier and more modern.)

data.title: Experience Great Theater Productions
data.text: The Hobby Center is a memorable venue where there isn't a bad seat!  TUTS productions never fail to bring great theater experiences because of top notch actors, set design, music, food, and great welcoming climate to all patrons. Check their website and purchase season tickets or single tickets for a favorite show.

data.title: TUTS is Tops!
data.text:
Seeing a production put on by TUTS is always a great time!  They offer a wide variety of shows throughout the season, with a ton of great holiday favorites, and a series of shows performed by the underground TUTS group which are always entertaining!  The actors are always engaging, but the sets tend to be minimal and the costumes a bit underwhelming.  For some of the more recent shows we thought the actors needed a little more emphasis on costuming and set design to really make the entire show more memorable.  Overall, TUTS is wonderful and a great choice for all ages!

Few things to note on the Hobby Center, though - traffic can be VERY hectic on show nights, so if you plan on getting to the Hobby Center early to have a cocktail before the show make sure you add in plenty of extra time.  Valet parking is also pricey at $20 (parking garage is $10, I think), and getting your vehicle after the show can usually takes a LONG time, so just be prepared to wait.

Cheers!

data.title: One of the Best Attractions for everyone
data.text:
We saw the "Million Dollar Quartet" last night maybe the only time Elvis Presley, Carl Perkins, Johnny Cash and Jerry Lee Lewis preofrmed together in history!
It was a recreation of a private performance in the studio of Sun Records in Dec 1955.

But we always go to the TUTS performances when we can. We have seen the Little Shop of Horrors, the LED ZEPPELIN TRIBUTE SHOW, Westside Story and many others.

These shows are BROADWAY QUALITY productions put on for FREEEE! for the public. If you want seats, you need to go early in the day and wait on line for tickets (up to 4). Or you can go anytime and sit on a blanket on the hill.

This is the greatest value and it is always a momorable experience. Highest recommendation possible!!

data.title: Very smooth transition fro m  dinner to the performance.   No hassles at all.
data.text: went to see Cabaret in the Spring.  enjoyed it very much.   the process is smooth and efficient.  had dessert at intermission.  I would definitely go back.

data.title: Tuts
data.text: I always love seeing plays there and it's always fun to go to the theatre for me and the restaurant in the theatre called artista is really really really good

data.title: Always a great seat!
data.text: This is the place to go for great theater production plays and VIP tickets. My wife and I have been to many shows here that are on the professional theater circuit and we have enjoyed the younger productions as well. The last show we saw was RENT performed by young adult theater students. VIP passes to The Grinch was really fun. But one of the best performances in this theater we saw was The Lion King. even in the upper deck the show included all viewers. Highly recommend a show here soon. Wicked is coming again!

data.title: Big Time Theatre in Cowboy Country!
data.text: We love TUTS musicals, from road shows to locally produced offerings.  This year, TUTS Underground has been especially fun, with a young, modern vibe as it showcases the newest theatrical offerings.  Regular shows may spotlight Mary Poppins and other old favorites, but Underground is edgy and unpredictable.  Nice to have the new as well as the stuff to take grandchildren to!

data.title: Amazing Shows
data.text: Theatre Under the Stars puts on amazing shows every season. They are definitely worth the ticket price.

data.title: Great locally produced musical theatre
data.text: TUTS is a fun place to see (mostly) locally produced musical theatre on a grand scale.  Mary Poppins was great fun for six 2nd graders and the adults that accompanied them.

data.title: Rivals the Country's Best
data.text: The quality of the performances and stagings brought to Houston by Theater Under the Stars cannot be overstated; it is simply the very best the country has to offer. If you can't see it on Broadway, then by all means see it in Houston courtesy of TUTS; you won't miss much, if anything.

data.title: Loved TUTS
data.text: We recently went and saw The Little Mermaid at TUTS. It was every bit as good as when I saw it on Broadway.

data.title: The shows!
data.text: The fun performances are numerous and fun for the family. Every year we go several times to enjoy each of the quality performances
